intro: Corynephorus canescens subsp. maritimus, commonly known as sea barleygrass, is a coastal grass species characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and silver-gray foliage. It thrives in saline and sandy environments, often found along shorelines and dunes. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing minute, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions such as wind and salt spray. This subspecies plays a role in stabilizing dune systems and preventing erosion in coastal ecosystems.
